citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"ca.cioos_e93770e2-bb6b-4b80-b2de-a9f6ea734f5f\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"CEOTR\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2022\", \"03\", \"10\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Essais au large d'Halifax. Les planeurs Slocum sont de petits v\u00e9hicules sans pilote \u00e0 nage libre qui utilisent les changements de flottabilit\u00e9 pour se d\u00e9placer verticalement et horizontalement dans la colonne d'eau selon un motif en dents de scie. Ils sont d\u00e9ploy\u00e9s pendant plusieurs jours ou plusieurs mois et recueillent des informations d\u00e9taill\u00e9es sur les processus physiques, chimiques et biologiques des oc\u00e9ans du monde. Le planeur Slocum a \u00e9t\u00e9 con\u00e7u et construit par Teledyne Webb Research Corporation, Falmouth, MA, USA.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"CEOTR\", \"title\": \"HFX dans l'oc\u00e9an Atlantique Nord-Ouest 2014-04-03\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"https://catalogue.cioosatlantic.ca/dataset/ca-cioos_e93770e2-bb6b-4b80-b2de-a9f6ea734f5f?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"ca.cioos_e93770e2-bb6b-4b80-b2de-a9f6ea734f5f\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"CEOTR\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2022\", \"03\", \"10\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Offshore Halifax Testing. Slocum gliders are small, free-swimming, unmanned vehicles that use changes in buoyancy to move vertically and horizontally through the water column in a saw-tooth pattern. They are deployed for days to several months and gather detailed information about the physical, chemical and biological processes of the world's oceans. The Slocum glider was designed and built by Teledyne Webb Research Corporation, Falmouth, MA, USA.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"CEOTR\", \"title\": \"HFX in Northwest Atlantic Ocean 2014-04-03\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"https://catalogue.cioosatlantic.ca/dataset/ca-cioos_e93770e2-bb6b-4b80-b2de-a9f6ea734f5f?local=en\"}]

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>Offshore Halifax Testing. Slocum gliders are small, free-swimming, unmanned vehicles that use changes in buoyancy to move vertically and horizontally through the water column in a saw-tooth pattern. They are deployed for days to several months and gather detailed information about the physical, chemical and biological processes of the world's oceans. The Slocum glider was designed and built by Teledyne Webb Research Corporation, Falmouth, MA, USA.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="#fr">Essais au large d'Halifax. Les planeurs Slocum sont de petits v√©hicules sans pilote √† nage libre qui utilisent les changements de flottabilit√© pour se d√©placer verticalement et horizontalement dans la colonne d'eau selon un motif en dents de scie. Ils sont d√©ploy√©s pendant plusieurs jours ou plusieurs mois et recueillent des informations d√©taill√©es sur les processus physiques, chimiques et biologiques des oc√©ans du monde. Le planeur Slocum a √©t√© con√ßu et construit par Teledyne Webb Research Corporation, Falmouth, MA, USA.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>

notes: Offshore Halifax Testing. Slocum gliders are small, free-swimming, unmanned vehicles that use changes in buoyancy to move vertically and horizontally through the water column in a saw-tooth pattern. They are deployed for days to several months and gather detailed information about the physical, chemical and biological processes of the world's oceans. The Slocum glider was designed and built by Teledyne Webb Research Corporation, Falmouth, MA, USA.

description_translated.en:
CIOOS-Atlantic is a consortium of partner institutions which are committed to the development of a data management and dissemination approach for oceanographic data from the Atlantic Seaboard, a region spanning from Labrador to the Maine / New Brunswick border.

Meaningful engagement and ongoing communication with a broad variety of stakeholders is an integral component of CIOOS-Atlantic, and we will work to meet the needs of the local oceanographic community and ensure regional interests are represented at the national level. Emphasis is placed on the creation of a system which promotes easy data access and supports the work of partners, researchers, industry, and more.
